channel.title: No internet connection - whonix-gateway
channel.description:
Hi, I am still very new to whonix, have managed to import whonix (.ova) into virtualbox and start it. I know that you have to start the whonix-gateway first and then the whonix-workstation. My problem is that the gateway stops at 5% when the connection is established.
My System: Locale/physical system (windows) does not (intentionally) get into the Internet. I go to the internet via another windows VM.
How do I have to configure whonix-gateway (virtualbox .ova) so that it - with these settings (no internet access from local system) - can access the internet?
whonix-gateway at standard: adapter1: NAT adapter2: internal network
my test (doesn't work): adapter1: bridge mode adapter2: internal network

item.title: No internet connection - whonix-gateway
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Documentation has chapters on computer security education and host security.

Read full topic

item.title: No internet connection - whonix-gateway
item.dc:creator: docks29
item.description:
i’m talking about these steps https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Debian_Tips
is that enough to prepare my host?

Read full topic

item.title: No internet connection - whonix-gateway
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
docks29:

is there any instruction available how to prepare the host machine to use whonix. i talk about a hidden network connections from my host system, which can decrease my anonymity

That status of that topic will be kept up-to-date here:

Whonix – 29 Feb 20

Torify Host Operating System

How to all traffic from the Host Operating System

Read full topic

item.title: No internet connection - whonix-gateway
item.dc:creator: docks29
item.description:
thanks a lot. is there any instruction available how to prepare the host machine to use whonix. i talk about a hidden network connections from my host system, which can decrease my anonymity

Read full topic

item.title: No internet connection - whonix-gateway
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
docks29:

first of all i have to connect from the host system and then use whonix?

Yes. Make sure your host internet connection is functional. Whonix will use just that normally as any other VM and even any other application would do.

docks29:

is it possible to connect from virtual box bypassing host machine?

Same answer as this: No internet connection - whonix-gateway

Read full topic

item.title: No internet connection - whonix-gateway
item.dc:creator: docks29
item.description:
hi. so if i have debian 10 as host system and using wi-fi adapter, first of all i have to connect from the host system and then use whonix? is it possible to connect from virtual box bypassing host machine?

Read full topic

item.title: No internet connection - whonix-gateway
item.dc:creator: Wh0p5
item.description:
Ahh, ok, i understood.

So it would be of no use if I would act as a maintainer.
Too bad!

Read full topic

item.title: No internet connection - whonix-gateway
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Wh0p5:

Is there a way (in the future) to support this?

Possible only as per this… Quote https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Unsupported

This feature is either undocumented, untested, or unsupported. Please help us implement this feature by becoming a maintainer.

Consider Free Support Principle.

It might be possible to get this feature implemented, documented, tested and/or supported by purchasing Professional Support.

Wh0p5:

I want use it whithout nested virtualization (virtrualbox with whonix in a vm with internet access).
With nested virtualization, i think, it will works too.

Comes with its own issues. See:

whonix.org – 7 Mar 20

Nested Virtualization - Whonix

It is possible to run Virtual Machines (VMs) inside other VMs. That is called Nested Virtualization.

Read full topic

item.title: No internet connection - whonix-gateway
item.dc:creator: Wh0p5
item.description:
Is there a way (in the future) to support this?

I want use it whithout nested virtualization (virtrualbox with whonix in a vm with internet access).
With nested virtualization, i think, it will works too.

Read full topic

item.title: No internet connection - whonix-gateway
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
That’s unfortunately unsupported.

Whonix – 19 Jun 20

Undocumented / Untested / Unsupported

This feature is either undocumented, untested, or unsupported. Options: Become Contributor / Apply Free Support Principle / Purchase Professional Support.

Read full topic

item.title: No internet connection - whonix-gateway
item.dc:creator: Wh0p5
item.description:
My other VM’s can access the internet via bridge mode. my locale system should not access the internet!

Read full topic

item.title: No internet connection - whonix-gateway
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Wh0p5 via Whonix Forum:

My System: Locale/physical system (windows) does not (intentionally) get into the Internet.

Whonix requires a functional host internet connection. If host internet
is not functional, Whonix cannot use internet either.

How do I have to configure whonix-gateway (virtualbox .ova) so that it - with these settings (no internet access from local system) - can access the internet?

whonix-gateway at standard:
adapter1: NAT
adapter2: internal network

my test (doesn’t work):
adapter1: bridge mode
adapter2: internal network

There’s no need to change Whonix default settings. That’s even
discouraged in documentation.

Read full topic
